title: [Pytorch cuda] A possible bug of 'torch.cuda.is_available()'
body_html:
Issue description

When I calling 'torch.cuda.is_available()' from both Ubuntu Terminal AND Pycharm, the function call 'is_available()' returns True in the terminal AND false in Pycharm. Then I suppose they mistakenly call different 'torch._C._cuda_getDeviceCount()', however their function calls direct to the same '_C.cpython-35m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so'. I don't understand why these confused results return?

body:
## Issue description

When I calling **'torch.cuda.is_available()'** from both Ubuntu Terminal AND Pycharm, the function call  **'is_available()'** returns True in the terminal AND false in Pycharm.  Then I suppose they mistakenly call different **'torch._C._cuda_getDeviceCount()'**,  however their function calls direct to the same **'_C.cpython-35m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so'**. I don't understand why these confused results return?
## Code example

![2018-08-15 11 04 06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5744449/44130153-a68c89bc-a07e-11e8-9575-5f1e758869af.png)
